Posts.Content: just had mylumpectomy on feb 6 and was back to work in two weeks--experienced very little pain after surgery and went home the same day--i was surprised at how quickly my body recovered because i am almost 61 and smoke-i too was terrified--i think we all feel that way--stay positive and remember that a great many women with this live long and healthy lives after treatment--the key word here is treatment--you must follow up on this--good luck
Posts.Title: Coping with fear and anxiety

Posts.Content: diagonosed with dcis high grade comedo microinvasion--my report doesn't say anything about estrogen or progesterone or her2--how do i fiind this our--have had lumpectomy and now waiting to start radiation in two weeks-i am really dreading this and really considering mastectomy--also on my pathology worried about 2mm irregularity at tip of wire localizatin needle wire near anterior margin--what does this mean--also my lumpectomy was in two sections one of whick was labelled anterior margin--waht is that abour--i though it qwas all supposed to come out in one piece to be safe-i,m having a hard time trying to decide what to do
Posts.Title: pathology

Posts.Content: On 3/16/2007 Witchdoctor wrote: Generally the ER/PR  etc. come shortly after the main pathology.  Also did they sample any lymphnodes?  Irradiation to the breast is not that bad but you will have fatique and skin irritation which can be anything from a sun tan to extreme redness and even some blistering.  Start moisturizing with Aloe vera gel or Bag Balm prior to treatment and during.  The area may be slightly tender. What is your age?
Posts.Title: pathology

Posts.Content: i,i., getting slower in my old age--do you mean that lumpecctomy with radiation is as good as mastecomy--thats how i read this--i was worried that having a node biopsy now would dealay the radiation--also would radiation do more harm than good if i did have a node that was positive and theydidn,t find it--wish this had been done with lumpectomy
Posts.Title: pathology

Posts.Content: i will be 61 on april 3--had no idea about breast cancer until now and can't beleive how ignorant i am about it--i check on the net and just get more confused there is so much conflicting information--i understand that high grade comedo is bad and don,t know why my surgeon didn,t check a lymph node--especially when i had microinvasion--is it too late now or should i just go ahead with radiation--don,t want to make a mistake with treatment options
Posts.Title: pathology

Posts.Content: no disscusion of chemo or inhibitors--my doctors are spread out and don,t seem to be in touch--live in canada so health care is provided without additional expense for almost everything--my report says grade 3 comedo 1.7 tumor size dcis with microinvasion--smallest margin 4mm--thanks for answering live in a small town and don't know anyone else with this--sure when i start treatment others from the area will show up--
Posts.Title: pathology

Posts.Content: how would lymph node check affect the radiation plan alreadyin place--supposed to start april 9 for 5weeks--do you have an idea of how often nodes are involved in grade 3 comedo and micorcapillary--also is mastectomy a better cure for this even if it is close to chest wall--thanks again
Posts.Title: pathology

Posts.Content: lumpectomy for comedo dcis feb 6/07--mammogram early april--started 5 weeks radiation april 11/07---saw  surgeon june 25 who told me i had one punctate calcification close to surgical area--shocked as the radiation oncologist never mentioned this during treatments and i saw her every monday for five weeks--she was well aware of this as i brought my xrays with me to the radiatin hospital for her to see before i started treatment--my follow up is at a different hospital with a different oncologist who i say june 29th--she told me to call in a couple of weeks and she will let me know what they are going to do-- i am very concerned that this is the same dcis i did all this surgery and treatment for in the first place--does anyone know what chances are that this could be nothing--i should have called friday but was too worried
Posts.Title: calcification

Posts.Content: same as me--i had the lumpectomy for calcifications that were dcis comedo but not a lump that could be felt--there were two wires put in prior to surgery and both them and all the calcifications were to be removed--this was taken out in two pieces and apparently xrayed to make sure it was all gone--i don,t know where this xtra calcificatin came form so soon after surgery and why they went ahead with radiation without checking it-i finally did call the oncology clinic in barrie  yesterday and they said the doctor will call me back with what they plan to do--it,s making me very nervous that i still had dcis when they started radiation--i never had much confidence in the radiaiton oncologist in toronto--she was always rushed and didn,t seem to know anything about me  she actually told me i was estrogen positve when in fact the follow up doctor who i now see that i am in fact negative--
Posts.Title: calcification
